Posts.EditableText: You already know how to use `{either` to display different messages depending on the value of an attribute, I think. So you just need to make one of the messages coloured. I think you can do something like: `{either player.trust<0:{colour:red:Oh dear! Your trust level is {player.trust}}|You have +{player.trust} levels of trust}` Or if you want to do the same message in different colours, you could make it: `Some text goes here` (I'm not sure if you're allowed to put `{color:` inside `{either` or vice versa… the text processor seems to vary from one command to another whether it evaluates them top-down or bottom-up)
Posts.HTML:
You already know how to use {either to display different messages depending on the value of an attribute, I think. So you just need to make one of the messages coloured.

I think you can do something like:
{either player.trust<0:{colour:red:Oh dear! Your trust level is {player.trust}}|You have +{player.trust} levels of trust}

Or if you want to do the same message in different colours, you could make it:
<span style="color: {either player.trust<0:red|black};">Some text goes here</span>

(I'm not sure if you're allowed to put {color: inside {either or vice versa… the text processor seems to vary from one command to another whether it evaluates them top-down or bottom-up)
